CBS Boston reported on April 29, 2013. 

A man lost his life savings on a carnival game. 

Daniel Kahneman, Jack L. Knetsch, and Richard H. Thaler wrote about anomalies. 

Their work discusses the endowment effect and loss aversion. 

It appeared in the Journal of Economic Perspective, volume 5, issue 1. 

Tom Stafford explored why we love to hoard. 

He also provided tips on overcoming it. 

This article was published by BBC News on July 17, 2012. 

I originally discussed this in a blog post for Harvard Business Review. 

The post was titled “The Disciplined Pursuit of Less.” 

It was published on August 8, 2012. 

Hal R. Arkes and Peter Aykon studied the sunk cost effect. 

Their findings appeared in the Psychological Bulletin, volume 125, issue 5. 

James Surowiecki wrote about the sunk-cost feeling in The New Yorker. 

This article was published on January 21, 2013. 

Daniel Shapero discussed great managers in a LinkedIn article. 

He noted that they prune as well as plant. 

This article was published on December 13, 2012. 

Mark Harris analyzed editing in the New York Times. 

He noted that “Ordinary People” won Best Picture in 1980. 

However, its editor Jeff Kanew was not nominated for Best Editing. 

Harris referenced his earlier article in the same piece. 

A video titled “Jack Dorsey: The CEO as Chief Editor” was uploaded on February 15, 2011.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The text references various sources discussing concepts related to decision-making, biases, and the importance of prioritization in life and work.
